verses.verse: The Lord <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> again to Moses <S%H4872><s%> and to Aaron, <S%H175><s%> saying <S%H559><s%> to them,

"Speak <S%H1696><s%> to the sons <S%H1121><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> saying, <S%H559><s%> 'These <S%H2088><s%> are the creatures <S%H9130><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you may eat <S%H398><s%> from all <S%H3605><s%> the animals <S%H929><s%> that are on the earth. <S%H776><s%>

'Whatever <S%H3605><s%> divides <S%H6536><s%> a hoof, <S%H6541><s%> thus making <S%H8156><s%> split <S%H8156><s%> hoofs, <S%H6541><s%> [and] chews <S%H5927><s%> the cud, <S%H1625><s%> among the animals, <S%H929><s%> that you may eat. <S%H398><s%>

'Nevertheless, <S%H389><s%> you are not to eat <S%H398><s%> of these, <S%H2088><s%> among those which chew <S%H5927><s%> the cud, <S%H1625><s%> or among those which divide <S%H6536><s%> the hoof: <S%H6541><s%> the camel, <S%H1581><s%> for though it chews <S%H5927><s%> cud, <S%H1625><s%> it does not divide <S%H6536><s%> the hoof, <S%H6541><s%> it is unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you.

'Likewise, the rock <S%H9627><s%> badger, <S%H9627><s%> for though it chews <S%H5927><s%> cud, <S%H1625><s%> it does not divide <S%H6536><s%> the hoof, <S%H6541><s%> it is unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you;
the rabbit <S%H768><s%> also, for though it chews <S%H5927><s%> cud, <S%H1625><s%> it does not divide <S%H6536><s%> the hoof, <S%H6541><s%> it is unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you;

and the pig, <S%H2386><s%> for though it divides <S%H6536><s%> the hoof, <S%H6541><s%> thus making <S%H8156><s%> a split <S%H8156><s%> hoof, <S%H6541><s%> it does not chew <S%H1641><s%> cud, <S%H1625><s%> it is unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you.
'You shall not eat <S%H398><s%> of their flesh <S%H1320><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> touch <S%H5060><s%> their carcasses; <S%H5038><s%> they are unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you.

'These <S%H2088><s%> you may eat, <S%H398><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> is in the water: <S%H4325><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that have fins <S%H5579><s%> and scales, <S%H7193><s%> those in the water, <S%H4325><s%> in the seas <S%H3220><s%> or in the rivers, <S%H5158><s%> you may eat. <S%H398><s%>

'But whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> is in the seas <S%H3220><s%> and in the rivers, <S%H5158><s%> that do not have <S%H369><s%> fins <S%H5579><s%> and scales <S%H7193><s%> among <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the teeming <S%H8318><s%> life <S%H8318><s%> of the water, <S%H4325><s%> and among <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the living <S%H2416><s%> creatures <S%H5315><s%> that are in the water, <S%H4325><s%> they are detestable <S%H8263><s%> things <S%H8263><s%> to you,
and they shall be abhorrent <S%H8263><s%> to you; you may not eat <S%H398><s%> of their flesh, <S%H1320><s%> and their carcasses <S%H5038><s%> you shall detest. <S%H8262><s%>
'Whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> in the water <S%H4325><s%> does not have <S%H369><s%> fins <S%H5579><s%> and scales <S%H7193><s%> is abhorrent <S%H8263><s%> to you.

'These, <S%H428><s%> moreover, you shall detest <S%H8262><s%> among <S%H4480><s%> the birds; <S%H5775><s%> they are abhorrent, <S%H8263><s%> not to be eaten: <S%H398><s%> the eagle <S%H5404><s%> and the vulture <S%H6538><s%> and the buzzard, <S%H5822><s%>
and the kite <S%H1676><s%> and the falcon <S%H344><s%> in its kind, <S%H4327><s%>
every <S%H3605><s%> raven <S%H6158><s%> in its kind, <S%H4327><s%>
and the ostrich <S%H3284><s%> and the owl <S%H8464><s%> and the sea <S%H7828><s%> gull <S%H7828><s%> and the hawk <S%H5322><s%> in its kind, <S%H4327><s%>
and the little <S%H9205><s%> owl <S%H9205><s%> and the cormorant <S%H7994><s%> and the great <S%H3244><s%> owl, <S%H3244><s%>
and the white <S%H8580><s%> owl <S%H8580><s%> and the pelican <S%H6893><s%> and the carrion <S%H7360><s%> vulture, <S%H7360><s%>
and the stork, <S%H2624><s%> the heron <S%H601><s%> in its kinds, <S%H4327><s%> and the hoopoe, <S%H1744><s%> and the bat. <S%H5847><s%>
'All <S%H3605><s%> the winged <S%H5775><s%> insects <S%H8318><s%> that walk <S%H1980><s%> on [all] fours <S%H702><s%> are detestable <S%H8263><s%> to you.

'Yet <S%H389><s%> these <S%H2088><s%> you may eat <S%H398><s%> among <S%H4480><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the winged <S%H5775><s%> insects <S%H8318><s%> which walk <S%H1980><s%> on [all] fours: <S%H702><s%> those which <S%H834><s%> have above <S%H4480><s%> <S%H4605><s%> their feet <S%H7272><s%> jointed legs <S%H3767><s%> with which <S%H1992><s%> to jump <S%H9351><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>

'These <S%H428><s%> of them you may eat: <S%H398><s%> the locust <S%H697><s%> in its kinds, <S%H4327><s%> and the devastating <S%H5556><s%> locust <S%H5556><s%> in its kinds, <S%H4327><s%> and the cricket <S%H2728><s%> in its kinds, <S%H4327><s%> and the grasshopper <S%H2284><s%> in its kinds. <S%H4327><s%>
'But all <S%H3605><s%> other winged <S%H5775><s%> insects <S%H8318><s%> which <S%H834><s%> are four-footed are detestable <S%H8263><s%> to you.

'By these, <S%H428><s%> moreover, you will be made <S%H2930><s%> unclean: <S%H2930><s%> whoever <S%H3605><s%> touches <S%H5060><s%> their carcasses <S%H5038><s%> becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening, <S%H6153><s%>

and whoever <S%H3605><s%> picks <S%H5375><s%> up any <S%H4480><s%> of their carcasses <S%H5038><s%> shall wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> and be unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening. <S%H6153><s%>

'Concerning all <S%H3605><s%> the animals <S%H929><s%> which <S%H834><s%> divide <S%H6536><s%> the hoof, <S%H6541><s%> but do not make <S%H8156><s%> a split <S%H8156><s%> [hoof], or which do not chew <S%H5927><s%> cud, <S%H1625><s%> they are unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you: whoever <S%H3605><s%> touches <S%H5060><s%> them becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean. <S%H2930><s%>

'Also whatever <S%H3605><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> on its paws, <S%H3709><s%> among all <S%H3605><s%> the creatures <S%H9130><s%> that walk <S%H1980><s%> on [all] fours, <S%H702><s%> are unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you; whoever <S%H3605><s%> touches <S%H5060><s%> their carcasses <S%H5038><s%> becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening, <S%H6153><s%>

and the one who picks <S%H5375><s%> up their carcasses <S%H5038><s%> shall wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> and be unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening; <S%H6153><s%> they are unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you.

'Now these <S%H2088><s%> are to you the unclean <S%H2931><s%> among the swarming <S%H8318><s%> things <S%H8318><s%> which swarm <S%H8317><s%> on the earth: <S%H776><s%> the mole, <S%H2467><s%> and the mouse, <S%H5909><s%> and the great <S%H9468><s%> lizard <S%H9468><s%> in its kinds, <S%H4327><s%>
and the gecko, <S%H604><s%> and the crocodile, <S%H9208><s%> and the lizard, <S%H3911><s%> and the sand <S%H2546><s%> reptile, <S%H2546><s%> and the chameleon. <S%H8580><s%>

'These <S%H428><s%> are to you the unclean <S%H2931><s%> among all <S%H3605><s%> the swarming <S%H8318><s%> things; <S%H8318><s%> whoever <S%H3605><s%> touches <S%H5060><s%> them when they are dead <S%H4194><s%> becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening. <S%H6153><s%>

'Also anything <S%H3605><s%> on which <S%H834><s%> one of them may fall <S%H5307><s%> when they are dead, <S%H4194><s%> becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean, <S%H2930><s%> including <S%H4480><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> wooden <S%H6086><s%> article, <S%H3627><s%> or <S%H176><s%> clothing, <S%H899><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a skin, <S%H5785><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a sack <S%H8242><s%> – any <S%H3605><s%> article <S%H3627><s%> of which <S%H834><s%> use <S%H4399><s%> is made <S%H6213><s%> – it shall be put <S%H935><s%> in the water <S%H4325><s%> and be unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening, <S%H6153><s%> then it becomes <S%H2891><s%> clean. <S%H2891><s%>

'As for any <S%H3605><s%> earthenware <S%H2789><s%> vessel <S%H3627><s%> into which <S%H834><s%> one of them may fall, <S%H5307><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> is in it becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> and you shall break <S%H7665><s%> the vessel.

'Any <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3605><s%> of the food <S%H400><s%> which <S%H834><s%> may be eaten, <S%H398><s%> on which <S%H834><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> comes, <S%H935><s%> shall become <S%H2930><s%> unclean; <S%H2930><s%> and any <S%H3605><s%> liquid <S%H4945><s%> which <S%H834><s%> may be drunk <S%H8354><s%> in every <S%H3605><s%> vessel <S%H3627><s%> shall become <S%H2930><s%> unclean. <S%H2930><s%>

'Everything, <S%H3605><s%> moreover, on which <S%H834><s%> part of their carcass <S%H5038><s%> may fall <S%H5307><s%> becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean; <S%H2930><s%> an oven <S%H8574><s%> or a stove <S%H3600><s%> shall be smashed; <S%H5422><s%> they are unclean <S%H2931><s%> and shall continue <S%H1961><s%> as unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you.

'Nevertheless <S%H389><s%> a spring <S%H4599><s%> or a cistern <S%H953><s%> collecting <S%H9288><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> shall be clean, <S%H2889><s%> though the one who touches <S%H5060><s%> their carcass <S%H5038><s%> shall be unclean. <S%H2930><s%>

'And if <S%H3588><s%> a part of their carcass <S%H5038><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on any <S%H3605><s%> seed <S%H2233><s%> for sowing <S%H2221><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is to be sown, <S%H2232><s%> it is clean. <S%H2889><s%>
'Though if <S%H3588><s%> water <S%H4325><s%> is put <S%H5414><s%> on the seed, <S%H2233><s%> and a part of their carcass <S%H5038><s%> falls <S%H5307><s%> on it, it is unclean <S%H2931><s%> to you.

'Also if <S%H3588><s%> one of the animals <S%H929><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> which <S%H834><s%> you have for food, <S%H402><s%> the one who touches <S%H5060><s%> its carcass <S%H5038><s%> becomes <S%H2930><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening. <S%H6153><s%>

'He too, who eats <S%H398><s%> some <S%H4480><s%> of its carcass <S%H5038><s%> shall wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> and be unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening; <S%H6153><s%> and the one who picks <S%H5375><s%> up its carcass <S%H5038><s%> shall wash <S%H3526><s%> his clothes <S%H899><s%> and be unclean <S%H2930><s%> until <S%H5704><s%> evening. <S%H6153><s%>
'Now every <S%H3605><s%> swarming <S%H8318><s%> thing <S%H8318><s%> that swarms <S%H8317><s%> on the earth <S%H776><s%> is detestable, <S%H8263><s%> not to be eaten. <S%H398><s%>

'Whatever <S%H3605><s%> crawls <S%H1980><s%> on its belly, <S%H1512><s%> and whatever <S%H3605><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> on [all] fours, <S%H702><s%> whatever <S%H3605><s%> has many <S%H7235><s%> feet, <S%H7272><s%> in respect to every <S%H3605><s%> swarming <S%H8318><s%> thing <S%H8318><s%> that swarms <S%H8317><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%> you shall not eat <S%H398><s%> them, for they are detestable. <S%H8263><s%>

'Do not render <S%H8262><s%> yourselves <S%H5315><s%> detestable <S%H8262><s%> through any <S%H3605><s%> of the swarming <S%H8318><s%> things <S%H8318><s%> that swarm; <S%H8317><s%> and you shall not make <S%H2930><s%> yourselves unclean <S%H2930><s%> with them so that you become <S%H2930><s%> unclean. <S%H2930><s%>

'For I am the Lord <S%H3068><s%> your God. <S%H430><s%> Consecrate <S%H6942><s%> yourselves therefore, and be holy; <S%H6918><s%> for I am holy. <S%H6918><s%> And you shall not make <S%H2930><s%> yourselves <S%H5315><s%> unclean <S%H2930><s%> with any <S%H3605><s%> of the swarming <S%H8318><s%> things <S%H8318><s%> that swarm <S%H7430><s%> on the earth. <S%H776><s%>

'For I am the Lord, <S%H3068><s%> who brought <S%H5927><s%> you up from the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> to be your God; <S%H430><s%> thus you shall be holy <S%H6918><s%> for I am holy. <S%H6918><s%>' "

This <S%H2088><s%> is the law <S%H8451><s%> regarding the animal, <S%H929><s%> and the bird, <S%H5775><s%> and every <S%H3605><s%> living <S%H2416><s%> thing <S%H2416><s%> that moves <S%H7430><s%> in the waters, <S%H4325><s%> and everything <S%H3605><s%> that swarms <S%H8317><s%> on the earth, <S%H776><s%>

to make <S%H914><s%> a distinction <S%H914><s%> between <S%H996><s%> the unclean <S%H2931><s%> and the clean, <S%H2889><s%> and between <S%H996><s%> the edible <S%H398><s%> creature <S%H9130><s%> and the creature <S%H9130><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is not to be eaten. <S%H398><s%>
